page.title: 01General information.
page.content: This area is a typical example of East Dorset farmland. Farming in the area is both dairy and arable, with some sheep. Of the five villages and hamlets, three are named after the Winterborne river, which is now rarely more than a stream, even in the wettest year. The total population is between 200 and 250, with over half living in Winterborne Zelston. Most of the working population are farmworkers, but some commute to the towns of Wimborne, Blandford, and the Bournemouth-Poole area. The A31, a major arterial route, passes through the area from N.E. to W., but avoids the settlements. As a result, the area is peaceful and 'unspoilt'. Tourists are rarely seen, but it's worth a day's visit if you are a city dweller.(Sssh!).....
